context: In the present study, we found that secretion of prostaglandins E2 and F2α was enhanced in A549 cells exposed to toluene, benzene or styrene. Prostaglandins PGE2 and PGF2α are suggested to enhance the phenotype of several inflammatory diseases by administrating pro-inflammatory effects (McCoy et al., 2002; Basu, 2007). As from in vitro studies suggested, PGE2 seems to polarize cellular response toward a Th2 phenotype by enhancing IL-4 and IL-5 production (Park and Christman, 2006). This is in accordance to results from previous studies that MCP-1, a pro-inflammatory mediator triggering immune response toward a Th2 phenotype, is increased in response to styrene or chlorobenzene (Lehmann et al., 2008). Suggesting that aromatic VOCs induce a Th2 phenotype in the lung Th2 cells produce the cytokines IL-4 and IL-13, which are known to stimulate the development of IgE-mediated allergic responses. In fact, we were able to show in an earlier study, that culture supernatants of chlorobenzene exposed lung epithelial cells induce an IL-13 release in primary T cells (Lehmann et al., 2008). Furthermore, there is evidence from an epidemiological study that exposure to chlorobenzene in the household can be associated with allergic sensitization and Th2 primed T-cell immunity in children (Lehmann et al., 2001).
